    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Scalpel's Point](/Feats.aspx?ID=1460) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Investigator" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=318" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 62 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
[forensic medicine methodology](/Methodologies.aspx?ID=3)

</column>

---

Your stratagems benefit from your precise knowledge of anatomy. When you critically hit with an attack on which you substituted your attack roll due to [Devising a Stratagem](/Actions.aspx?ID=546), if your attack dealt piercing or slashing damage, you also deal 1d6 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) to your target.
